sequences

Class FastaSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • sequences.FastaSequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Sequence
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenomicFastaSequence, ProteinFastaSequence

    public class FastaSequence
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sequence, java.io.Serializable
    An implementation of the Sequence class allowing a fasta file to be used as the database.
    Author:
    jung
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastaSequence

        public FastaSequence(java.lang.String filepath)
        Constructor. The alphabet will be created dynamically according from the fasta file.
        Parameters:
        filepath - the path to the fasta file.

      • FastaSequence

        public FastaSequence(java.lang.String filepath,
             java.lang.String alphabet)
        Constructor using the specified alphabet set. If there is a letter not in the alphabet, it will be encoded as the TERMINATOR byte.
        Parameters:
        filepath - the path to the fasta file.
        alphabet - the specifications alphabet string. This could take the predefined AminoAcid strings defined in this class or customized strings.

      • FastaSequence

        public FastaSequence(java.lang.String filepath,
             java.lang.String alphabet,
             java.lang.String seqExtension)
        Constructor using the specified alphabet set. If there is a letter not in the alphabet, it will be encoded as the TERMINATOR byte.
        Parameters:
        filepath - the path to the fasta file.
        alphabet - the specifications alphabet string. This could take the predefined AminoAcid strings defined in this class or customized strings.
        seqExtension - the extension to use for the sequence file.

      • toChar

        public char toChar(byte b)
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Take a byte and reverse translate it to the original string representation. Note that some bytes might represent more than one character. An arbitrary character is returned. To find out what the original char was, the getCharAt method should be called instead
        Specified by:
        toChar in interface Sequence
        Parameters:
        b - the byte.
        Returns:
        the String representation of the given byte.

      • getAnnotation

        public java.lang.String getAnnotation(long position)
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Get the annotation corresponds to the given position. Annotation can be any string. For example, if the object represented is a fasta file, annotation will be the lines start with ">".
        Specified by:
        getAnnotation in interface Sequence
        Parameters:
        position - the position to query. Annotations are mapped to certain ranges of the sequence indices, so this function will return the annotation for the subsequence that falls within this range
        Returns:
        the annotation string corresponds to the given position.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getMatchingEntry

        public java.lang.String getMatchingEntry(long position)
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Get the complete entry that corresponds to the given position. A chunk is a contiguous sequence that shares an annotation (e.g. Protein).
        Specified by:
        getMatchingEntry in interface Sequence
        Parameters:
        position - the position to query.
        Returns:
        the entry as a string corresponds to the given position.

      • getMatchingEntry

        public java.lang.String getMatchingEntry(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Get the complete entry that corresponds to the given fasta entry header. A chunk is a contiguous sequence that shares an annotation (e.g. Protein).
        Specified by:
        getMatchingEntry in interface Sequence
        Parameters:
        name - the header of the fasta entrry.
        Returns:
        the entry as a string.
